fields.description: This is to workaround for customers in the mean time until STASH-4228 is released (in 2.12)
fields.summary: Increase license service cache expiration

fields.description: Stash shouldn't offer to delete source branch after merging for release branches.
fields.summary: Don't offer to delete source branch for release branches

fields.description: I am trying to leave a comment on the changes to the file StaticContentMacroModuleBean.java but cannot.  I have clicked everything.  I am logged in.  My mouse works.  There are other comments on this file.  I have tried a different browser.  I am confused.
fields.summary: Can't leave comment.

fields.description:
I'm using Stash, and constantly I get logged out both in Firefox and Chrome stating: Invalid remember-me token.

This is very annoying because most of the times I can only do 3 or 4 clicks and I get logged out.
fields.summary: Invalid remember-me token

fields.description:
A comment is made on line of diff.
Line is changed and the commit is amended.
In the overview the comment is marked as outdated, which it should be, but in the diff pane the comment is still there.

As far as I have noticed and understood a comment should only show in the overview history once outdated and no longer show in the diff.

The only times I have seen this issue happen is when a commit is amended instead of new commits, but whether that is the cause I am unsure...
fields.summary: outdated comments still visible

fields.description:
A comment is made on line of diff.
Line is changed and the commit is amended.
In the overview the comment is marked as outdate, which it should, but in the diff pane the comment is still there.

As far as I have noticed and understood a comment should only show in the overview history once outdated and no longer show in the diff.

The only times I have seen this issue happen is when a commit is amended instead of new commits, but whether that is the cause I am unsure...
fields.summary: outdated comments still visible

fields.description: Here's a challenge for an enterprising developer: find a way to turn a pull request comment into a commit which adds a code comment.
fields.summary: Turn pull request comments into code comments

fields.description:
It would be useful if Stash could display SVG files in page when browsing to an svg file rather than the XML source code.

We have large icon repositories that we need to review changes to and being able to see the image in browser (when supported) would make things a lot easier.
fields.summary: Inline display of svg files

fields.description:
As an administrator, I would like to be able to edit the address that is linked on the Stash logo using the Stash UI.

If I have a proxy and configure the {{proxyName}} parameter, I can't change it (even by tweaking the Base URL) as it is hard coded to pick it up from there.

Also, sometimes depending on the proxy configuration, this link could be changed to some URL and it takes time to debug. Having control of what is there is a better solution for a Stash admin.
fields.summary: Make the Stash logo address configurable via UI

fields.description: I think it's important for moral to be able to drag and drop images into comments, especially animated gifs, it's great fun the team.
fields.summary: Drag and drop images into PR comments field

fields.description: The client would like to run Stash as a WAR deployment on Tomcat then proxy through Apache with mod_jk using ajp version 13. I found a comment on STASH-3000 that says WAR deployment is in fact not supported by Atlassian, but just want to confirm this is still the case.
fields.summary: Stash WAR deployment support

fields.description: Please make Stash and JIRA have the same text markup languages. It's hard to remember how to create a link using Markdown or the JIRA formatting. Particularly, things like monospace {{}} on JIRA vs. backticks on Stash.
fields.summary: Stash and JIRA have different text markup languages
Make warning more visible on user directory screen

fields.description:
It would be nice if the Reject Force Push Hook also blocked fork syncing's [Synchronise Discard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Keeping+forks+synchronized#Keepingforkssynchronized-Discardstrategy] option.

We've had trouble with people discarding rather than merging and it would be nice if the hook provided the same protection as it does to doing it on the command line.
fields.summary: Reject Force Push Hook and Synchronise Discard

fields.description:
Hi there,

It was going to be really useful for our users if they could get the system information using Rest API.

Like how much data is used by Stash, how much memory is used by Stash process, status/healthcheck, etc.
fields.summary: System information in admin settings, or using REST API

fields.description: I find it handy to see what the last commit was to a repo in when sifting around. It would be nice to see this on /browse
fields.summary: See last commit in repo view

fields.description:
It would be nice to clean up the comments when you do a force push

git push -f me feature/doge

I think comments on outdated diffs should be collapsed and the history cleaned up, it goes 'added' 'removed' each time you do a force push.

You may think i'm a scumbag but it's my fork and I will do what I want to :)
fields.summary: Better display of updated/outdated commits in pull request activity

fields.description:
I favour and recommend rebase heavy workflows and think it should be un-checked by default.

I prefer to:

git checkout feature/doge
git fetch origin
git rebase origin/master
git push -f me feature/doge

I realise that this feature is kind of harmless but I fork ALL THE THINGS and forget to uncheck the thing.

I do worry about people clicking buttons in the Stash UI and making ugly merge commits all over the place, I think people should work through it on their machine and rebase squash etc.

This is all very opinionated I know....

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-3425

BTW this is my first time using stash and it's pretty cool, thanks!
fields.summary: Uncheck fork syncing

fields.description:
after clicking search the wait \ spin continues for ever.

for a system admin though the result is back instantaneously.
fields.summary: admin at project level unable to search for Add Hook --> Search

fields.description:
As a code reviewer I would like to be able to see the whole source file as context to a diff view, not just the 10 lines before and after each change. I can sort of approximate this by repeatedly clicking on the buttons around the context that expand it until the whole file is visible, but this is somewhat clumsy. It would be far more convenient to have a button that displays the full context in one click.

There is a slightly disappointing "View the full source of this file" button which sounds like it would be the thing I want, but does not display the diff.
fields.summary: View whole file context in pull request diff

fields.description: This will depend on _how_ the license is invalid. If the license is in the correct form (eg. length), but one character is wrong, then the user may see a 500 error rather than "The provided license is not valid".
fields.summary: Some invalid licenses show 500 errors when saving

fields.description: In PR lists, overviews of PRs, and elsewhere, the branch name is listed nicely, but when it's too long, it's truncated. It's very convenient to be able to copy the full branch name (to use on the command line, etc.), but I haven't found a way to do this. There's a hover tip with the full name, but you can't copy it.
fields.summary: Branch names in various parts of the UI are truncated

fields.description: Right now the latest Stash (2.9) doesn't support of source code formatting during code review for pull request at all - all files is displayed as plain text.  In ideal situation Stash should offers similar solution related to formatting which is available in Crucible web module.
fields.summary: Support of source code formatting during code review for pull request

fields.description:
Currently we can style both Confluence and JIRA to match our internal branding, but Stash is left behind. 

Because we often have project "triplets" where the same project has a Confluence Space + JIRA Project + Stash Project, it would be great to maintain visual continuity as people jump from one application to the next.
fields.summary: Ability to style Stash to match JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
Our teams workflow has Database changes in a separate project and repository then the Code changes. we can track this successfully in Jira using blocked issue linking. however once a code and db change needs to go out stash does not know one pull request depends on another. 
It would be helpful if a pull request could be blocked by another pull request and even nicer if it could get that information from Jira.
fields.summary: Dependent cross-repo pull requests

fields.description:
We would like to have a stash Project Role which labels a user as Project Leader or Owner. Simular to the role in JIRA.
We have a very large group of users which changes a lot and to keep track of repositories we would like to assign an Owner (or Project Leader) to a project.
This seems not possible as far as I can see.
fields.summary: Project Leader role for stash project

fields.description:
Currently, BitBucket has the feature to add inline comments to *each commit* on the Pull Request view, Crucible as well employs this feature whereby Stash only has the ability to add the inline comments on the 'Diff' view only, not for each commit.

Would be feasible to have the inline comments for each commit in Stash in the same way how BitBucket and Crucible work.
fields.summary: As a reviewer, I'd like to add inline comments on for each 'commit' on the Pull Request page

fields.description:
Currently, 'Reject Force Push' hook is only configurable for each individual repo which makes it hard to configure for every newly created repo. 

Would be feasible to have the *global* settings for this hook whereby the sysadmin can configure it globally in order to override the configurations for each individual repo. This should be done through UI
fields.summary: As a System Admin, I'd like to configure 'Reject Force Push' hook globally from the UI

fields.description:
Whenever Stash is upgraded following instructions, I get the classic RSA fingerprint has changed error:

{code}
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@ WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED! @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!
Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
It is also possible that the RSA host key has just been changed.
The fingerprint for the RSA key sent by the remote host is
13:c9:f6:9d:c1:67:16:95:69:27:08:4a:c9:16:62:75.
Please contact your system administrator.
Add correct host key in /home/USER/.ssh/known_hosts to get rid of this message.
Offending key in /home/USER/.ssh/known_hosts:1
RSA host key for stash.customer.com has changed and you have requested strict checking.
Host key verification failed.
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

This means that every time I upgrade Stash I have to go and rewrite that identification in {{known_hosts}} on all developer machines and continuous integration build slaves.

It would be *very* useful if I could somehow keep the same fingerprint from before. This does not have to be the default behavior.

If this is already possible, consider documenting this in the [upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+upgrade+guide]
fields.summary: Keep server RSA fingerprint after upgrade

fields.description: Apache commons-fileupload 1.3.1 was released this weekend with a fix for CVE-2014-0050, involving a DoS attack when using specially crafted multipart requests.
fields.summary: Security vulnerability in apache commons fileupload

fields.description:
"It's weird--Stash's Overview tab on a PR unpredictably (to this n00b, anyway) shows an out-of-date comment/diff. Helpfully, they're labeled as "Outdated" in the UI (when would I want to look at an outdated comment in the Overview tab, by default?).
Looking at the Diffs tab is always right.

Take a look at this PR: [REDACTED]

The first and last comments/code are up-to-date, but all of the comments/code in-between are marked as "Outdated"--the code has in fact been changed, but you can't see it unless you go to the Diffs tab."

My response:
"Overview is more of an "activity feed".
"when would I want to look at an outdated comment in the Overview tab, by default?" I really like this behavior ... I can see whether a comment has actually been resolved or not (as opposed to being accidentally hidden because I incidentally changed the line"

Responding to me:
"that seems like it would make sense if the top and bottom comment blocks's associated code weren't updated. Unfortunately, it's inconsistent which code blocks update and which don't."

Is this a bug, or is there an underlying logic we don't understand?
fields.summary: PR overview sometimes shows out-of-date diffs

fields.description:
Currently, titles of Stash pages look like this:
Pull requests for repository myRepo - Square Stash

The should be something like:
myRepo - Pull Requests - Stash

This is important when you have multiple tabs open in your browser (who doesn't?)--the most important information needs to be at the beginning of the title.
(Since the Stash favicon is the first thing in the tab, I'd argue that putting "Stash" or "Square Stash" in the title is redundant.)
fields.summary: Page titles should have repo name at the beginning
Support initial timeout for ajax.poll method

fields.description:
If you run some tasks from com.atlassian.sal.api.scheduling.PluginScheduler them will be runned with WebappClassloader.

If your plugin job try to check merge vetos for other pull request via com.atlassian.stash.scm.pull.MergeRequestCheckService in this job thread, then all MergeChecks will executed not in http-threads-xxx, bu in other threads. And then, if you try to serialize ListHashMultimap in some of this MergeChecks (other plugins), you may get strange exception:
{code}
2014-02-10 01:46:42,645 WARN  [scheduler_Worker-5]  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.acme.stash.plugin.other.content.SomeKeyInSetMultimap
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass(WebappClassLoader.java:1702) ~[catalina.jar:7.0.47]
        at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:249) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.resolveClass(ObjectInputStream.java:602) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readNonProxyDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1589) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readClassDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1494) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1748) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1327) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:349) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at com.google.common.collect.Serialization.populateMultimap(Serialization.java:184) ~[guava-10.0.1.jar:na]
        at com.google.common.collect.LinkedHashMultimap.readObject(LinkedHashMultimap.java:383) ~[guava-10.0.1.jar:na]
        at java.io.ObjectStreamClass.invokeReadObject(ObjectStreamClass.java:969) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readSerialData(ObjectInputStream.java:1871) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1775) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1327) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.defaultReadFields(ObjectInputStream.java:1969) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readSerialData(ObjectInputStream.java:1893) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1775) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1327) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:349) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.util.HashSet.readObject(HashSet.java:291) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectStreamClass.invokeReadObject(ObjectStreamClass.java:969) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readSerialData(ObjectInputStream.java:1871) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1775) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1327) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
        at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:349) ~[na:1.6.0_45]
... (skipped) ...
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.pull.DefaultMergeRequestCheckService.check(DefaultMergeRequestCheckService.java:46) [stash-service-impl-2.10.1.jar:na]
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy168.check(Unknown Source) [na:na]
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy218.check(Unknown Source) [na:na]
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy218.check(Unknown Source) [na:na]
        at com.acme.stash.plugin.pull.merge.AutoMergingJob$2.perform(AutoMergingJob.java:218) [plugin.6818593026216650093.stash-pull-request-automerge-1.0.32_1390605423000.jar:na]
{code}

The bug only in this thread, the same check from Web UI work fine. I think, that PluginScheduler load tasks in not valid ClassLoader.
fields.summary: Problems with serialization ListHashMultimap in not HTTP threads

fields.description:
The current password security level (complexity) for "Stash Internal Directory" is extremely unsafe and is inappropriate for the present time.
 As an administrator, I want to set the following parameters to control the password policy:
 - Minimum length (int, default 8)
 - Must contain Uppercase Letters (bool)
 - Must contain Lowercase Letters (bool)
 - Must contain at least a Number (bool)
 - Must contain at least a Symbol (bool)

h3. Workaround:

Use external user directories such as Microsoft Active Directory or Atlassian Crowd (which allows defining a [Password Regex|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Configuring+an+Internal+Directory]).
fields.summary: As an administrator i like to set a password security level for user passwords

fields.description:
*Scenario 1: OK*
Add a comment to a line in a file while viewing the diff of a pull request.
Add a mention of a Stash user and some text.
Save the comment.
Result: the mentioned user gets a notification email (working as expected).

*Scenario 2: _NOK_*
Now add a comment and do the same except adding the mention.
Save the comment.
Go to the pull request overview tab.
Edit the comment and add the mention.
Save the comment.

_Expected result:_ the mentioned user should get a notification email.
_Actual result:_ the mentioned user does NOT get an email.
fields.summary: Notification not sent when adding mention to comment when editing

fields.description: If a post-recieve web hook is configured to start a build via Bamboo's REST API and XSRF is enabled, we require the header {{X-Atlassian-Token: no-check}} to be sent to avoid the XSRF check
fields.summary: No way to set XSRF check header in post receive web hook

fields.description:
Since Stash instance is under 500 users load, with ~1500 repos, in some of them over 10000 pull requests — database engine (Hibernate, i suppose) sometime is locked and fires an error.

For example, you merge pull request, it is merged success, but Activity failed to add into database and pull request has no Activity records that it was merged. Missed link to merge commit. Etc.

The same is for comments.

Will be nice to have spinlock in this place, to lock UI until database was released and update can be performed success. Do not stop trying if only error occurs once. Try again and again. Spin lock :)

Maybe some timeout really usefull in this situation, to avoid locking entire application to some reason. Bu, i think, that 99% problems will be solved by simple spinlocking for a twice loop step.
fields.summary: Database on high load extremly bugly

fields.description:
When I create a Pull Request from a feature branch, the PR title defaults to the branch name. If the branch names follow an issue key convention, then the PR title is nothing more than the issue key. This isn't terribly helpful when faced with a list of PRs.

It would be better, perhaps, if any JIRA issues linked to the PR could be used to populate the PR title. It gets a bit fuzzy when there are multiple linked issues, though.
fields.summary: Populate Pull Request title from linked JIRA issue

fields.description:
!file-cannot-be-rendered.png!

When reviewing a pull-request, some times Stash cannot render the contents of a file, if it's a binary file for example, which is OK.

However, it doesn't allow me to add any comment in that file, which makes it hard to give feedback to the developer.

For example, if I want to ask the developer to remove a specific file and re-open the pull-request, I can't just type in a comment in that specific file. I have to type a comment in the general comments section of the pull-request and try to give the developer instructions on how to find the file I'm referring to.
fields.summary: Ability to comment on files that cannot be rendered

fields.description:
As an admin I'd like to be able to save my password as an encrypted string in the backup-config.properties so that my organization's security guidelines are adhered (not allowed to use clear text passwords anywhere) and so that I feel more secure.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Support encrypted passwords in backup-config.properties

fields.description:
Then build just addded to queue, it not INPROGRESS yet. Will be nice to have such status for this.

Linked issue in Teamcity tracker:
http://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/TW-34550
fields.summary: Add BuildStatus.QUEUED status into build-integration plugin

fields.description:
Branch permissions can be added to users that have no effect, eg adding a Write permission to read-only or blocked user. There should be some feedback to the repository admin to tell them what permissions have no effect and why.

cf https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/193624/branch-permissions-not-working
fields.summary: Improve user feedback for adding branch permissions
Branch permissions documentation is unclear

fields.description:
Sometimes pull-requests get merged by mistake, and although we can easily undo that in Git (git reset HEAD~1 + push --force or git revert + push), the pull-request is marked as merged forever... Which is inconsistent with that is in the source control.

I'd like to have a button on merged pull-requests that allow me to undo and reopen a pull-request (even if it doesn't do anything with the Git repository and I have to update the commits manually).
fields.summary: Ability to undo (and re-open) the merge of a pull-request

fields.description: When an AD group gets modified or removed from the DC, it magically disappears from the Stash Project it is associated with and does not get picked up by the Audit Logs. There is no mechanism to notify the users or administrators that that group was removed or modified from the DC. The group should at least be disabled but not removed to give the administrator a chance to troubleshoot the access issues.
fields.summary: Missing AD group in Stash Project getting bypassed from Audit Log

fields.description:
It would be be awesome if we could have more security implementations in Stash.
Like using Ciphers and MACs or other methods.
fields.summary: Restricting SSH 7999 to use certain Ciphers and MACs

fields.description:
There is no way in stash to easily browse other user's profiles to view their personal git repos (unless you try to find a commit or something with a link to their profile)

A better method would be something like what's offered in confluence, the people directory (eg. https://confluence.atlassian.com/browsepeople.action?startIndex). Using the same concept, a sub section named "People with Repositories" would make it even better.
fields.summary: People directory for stash

fields.description: Hello we would like to be able to specify a remote repository on the webUI in order clone from. This would help us when setting up new repositories. The real benefit would arise when you use this feature to provide repository synchronisation with remote repositories like with fork syncing. This helps the developers to just keep an eye on "our" repositories, the rest is performed automatically by Stash.
fields.summary: Clone from and synch with remote repository

fields.description:
Go into project/repo commits tab. Try to pres branch selector, type anything, wait a few seconds. This dialog will be closed suddenly. Press again -- it show with entered information before.
If you do not touch keyboard for this dialog -- it will be shown forever.
This bug reproduced if you move mouse away from area of this dialog. If mouse within area of dialog, this bug will not reproduced.
fields.summary: Hidding popups after a while

fields.description:
/plugins/servlet/$webResourceManager.getStaticResourcePrefix()/download/resources/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser:assets/rab/rest-api-browser.min.js

-- returns 404
fields.summary: Developer Toolbox REST API does not work
As a Stash Admin, I'd like to have the projects and repositories statistics shown on the Admin dashboard

fields.description:
A 404 will be shown in some places, and the URL will have 'mvc' missing.

Discovered here:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/253670/pull-request-url-link-is-not-valid/253708
fields.summary: Projects with MVC as their key broken on some pages

fields.description:
Turns out I wasted a couple of hours discovering that Stash 2.10.1 only works with a back-revved version of the MySQL Connector (mysql-connector-java-5.1.10.jar) while the version include with EL 6.4:

root@ma-gncspsd-lapp44:/ngs/app/stash# rpm -q mysql-connector-java
mysql-connector-java-5.1.17-6.el6.noarch

... causes this error on startup:

org.springframework.jdbc.CannotGetJdbcConnectionException: Could not get JDBC Connection; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLNonTransientConnectionException: Could not create connection to database server. Attempted reconnect 3 times. Giving up.
fields.summary: Stash only works with back-revved mysql-connector-java.jar

fields.description:
Not sure if I remember correctly, but shouldn't all pull request actions have a relative time?

Comments used to show as being posted "4 hours ago", now only show the date they were posted (eg "31 Jan 2014").
fields.summary: What happened to relative times?

fields.description: The system information page is first of all hard to find. Secondly is hardly read-able. I'd like to have it outputted as Confluence has it.
fields.summary: Improve system information page

fields.description: Go to a merge commit and change the diff to parent. The changeset changes but the trigger still has the old parent id.
fields.summary: Changeset parent selector does not update trigger

fields.description: I would love the ability to sort the pull request list on the 'Open', 'Merged', 'Declined' tabs.  Specifically, I asking for the ability to sort that list based on ID, Title, Author, Approval Status, Source, and Destination.  As a bonus, having an additional tab that shows only open pull requests with 0 approvals.
fields.summary: Sorting pull requests

fields.description:
On a number of occasions in the past few weeks, I have attempted to decline pull requests, only to find out later than I had declined and then merged them.

Most of the time, I see this:

# I click the "Decline" button.
# I'm given the popup error informing me that my information is out-of-date.
# I refresh the page.
# I click "Decline" and close the tab or navigate away.

Most recently, I did not receive the error popup, and so I did not realize that the merge had occurred until I later ran a {{git log}} myself.

When I visit the pull request page again, I see records indicating that I declined and _then_ merged the pull request. This is particularly odd since a merge cannot be performed on a declined request.

I am using Google Chrome 32.0.1700.77 on OS X Mavericks (10.9.1). I am one of the few people at work using Chrome on a Mac to go through pull requests (most are on Linux), and to my knowledge, I am the only person who has experienced this.

I realize that this isn't much information to go on; I'll happily provide more if given guidance as to what information I can collect by myself or via our administrators.
fields.summary: Clicking "Decline" declines and then merges a pull request

fields.description:
It can't find a way to join a comment for any action to JIRA issues linked to a pull request.

There're only basic fields about the issue's state and assignee, ie: "Summary", "Assignee", "Resolution", "Fix Version/s", "Issue Type" and "Due Date".

The last two of them are given the "Edit this field in JIRA" option but it implies that the browser navigates to the JIRA actual instance... hence voiding the benefits of the JIRA integration plugin's dialog in Stash.

Adding a comment when changing a task's state is essential to me so if there's no means currently to do that in Stash it'd be really a great one to work on.

Otherwise, could someone please point me where the option is available (I can't find it in the plugin administration page).
fields.summary: Comment Field in JIRA Issue Dialog

fields.description:
Hello,

First, I apologize if this has been fixed in later versions.

We have recently performed a basic security audit and there are a couple of low-risk points of interest that if fixed, would make your product look better on subsequent audits.

The first is that the login page allows the browser to auto-complete, which means that sensitive information could be stored in the browser.  I understand that for some users it may more of a feature, but in an enterprise environment this is a potential key to intellectual property.  If you wish to accommodate your smaller users then perhaps make it an option in the administrative interface to turn on and off.  The fix (if not already fixed in newer releases) may be as simple as adding an autocomplete=off in the form tag.

The second issue is that secure pages can be cached by the browser.  Again, some customers may want this for some reason, but when intellectual property is at stake it is better to turn this off on the server side.  A potential method is to set the HTTP header with:

'Pragma: No-cache' and 'Cache-control: No-cache'.


As a side note there seems to be potential for CSRF, but without definitive results I am not officially reporting them.  If it turns out to be exploitable I'll create a new issue.


Thanks,
James
fields.summary: Security Audit - Some Minor Changes Would Help

fields.description:
Allow defining "Repository templates" as a STASH-Admin:

For each new repository which is created within STASH the template should be applied
fields.summary: Repository Templates

fields.description: I think that show repository size on Settings page affect calculation on dist. For small repos all fast, but for large repos on heavy filesystem load, calculation of folder size may take some time. Will be nice to have trobler in this place and calculate size by AJAX async request.
fields.summary: Settings page of repository loading for a long time on large repos

fields.description:
As a security engineer I would like Stash to automatically invite me into any new code review in a repo whenever:

* Specific files are modified
* Certain code constructs are removed by the change under review
* Certain code constructs are added by the change under review
* Commit message matches a specified pattern.

We have some functionality in Panopticon which watches a set of files specified per repo. We also match diffs - whether the "removed" patch matches a substring or whether "added" part matches other substrings.

A filename match and a regex on diffs will probably to it. Our somewhat extensive configs are in https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/repo_monitor_configuration/

This function can be a plugin. 

(ex-Facebook) Phabricator has a related function - Herald - http://www.phabricator.com/docs/phabricator/article/Herald_User_Guide.html. The whole idea of "actions based on rules" is very nice - at the moment we (SE) need only "invite this user to the review" or, even better, "invite one of these users to the review if none of them are on it already".
fields.summary: Auto-inviting specific users into open code reviews based on rules

fields.description:
Currently, messages posted to hipchat are 

{quote}
*Joe User* committed to 1 branch at +Project/Repository+
*On branch "master"*
- Commit message here and truncate... (+a0b1c243+)
{quote}

This means 3 lines per commit, which can easily cause conversations to get lost in the noise. We had this with our previous use of subversion (in that case, posting the entire multi-line commit message), and changing to just post the first line with a link to the web viewer made a remarkable difference. 

I know this seems very trivial, but it's relatively easy and makes the experience that much nicer.

Therefore, I'd propose the template changes based on context. 

h3. Single commit to 1 branch:

Single line in hipchat.

{quote}
*Joe User* committed to branch *"master"* at +Project/Repository+: Commit message here and truncate... (+a0b1c243+)
{quote}

h3. Multiple commits to 1 branch:

Line per commit, plus header

{quote}
*Joe User* committed to branch *"master"* at +Project/Repository+
- Commit message here and truncate... (+a0b1c243+)
- Second commit message... (+b30c72c8+)
{quote}

h3. Multiple commits to >1 branch:

Basically, just as-is:

{quote}
*Joe User* committed to 2 branches at +Project/Repository+
*On branch "master"*
- Commit message here and truncate... (+a0b1c243+)
- Second commit message... (+b30c72c8+)

*On branch "1.0"*
- Another commit message... (+c94fe7c6+)
{quote}
fields.summary: Make Hipchat messages more concise

fields.description: When stash prompts to login, it forgets the URL I was originally going to. That means after I log in, I land on the stash homepage, rather than the PR I was linked.
fields.summary: Redirect after login is broken

fields.description:
When viewing a repo's branches page using the Google Chrome browser, if there are a large number of branches, the browser crashes more than 50% of the time.  This does not happen with Firefox.

I'm attaching a sample repo that causes the problem to manifest. It's a mostly empty repo with 102 branches.
fields.summary: Repos with large number of branches crashes Google Chrome browser

fields.description:
The landing page for Stash is empty. See attached screenshot. This is a problem because the first experience for a new user is an obvious bug, which doesn't instill a lot of confidence in the product.

(There are definitely projects that exist in this installation.)
fields.summary: Projects page is blank
API 404 response is XML, not JSON

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

Our style guides require lines to be less than 150 chars for java and 80 chars for all other languages and it would be nice to have a way of configuring stash to provide a line showing these length limits.

Most review systems just have a vertical red line at the configured length limit and that would do fine for us, but highlighting characters that are longer than the limit would also work.
fields.summary: Highlight line length

fields.description:
Our users would like to be able to set a notification flag on the review saying that they are reviewing it (similar to crucible/fisheye) so that the requester and other reviewers know who's actively working on the code review.

This is imagined as:
* An additional button (or drop down from "approve") which has "start/stop progress" (similar to Jira)
* An additional symbol on reviewer images which shows who is reviewing it (similar to the green tick which is used to indicate that a review is approved by a user). Probably something like a yellow straight or looped arrow to indicate in progress.
fields.summary: Add review state

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Have about 20 active pull requests for a user
2. Open "My Pull request" list (9 pull requests are shown)
3. Scroll down the list to show the 11 remaining pull requests. 

Problem:
When the "lazy load" spinner appear, chrome tab crashes.

Reproduced 10 out of 10 times. 

Latest Chrome version used:
Version 32.0.1700.77
fields.summary: More than 20 active pull requests crash Chrome tab

fields.description: As the Jira issue number is already listed within the table, it would be nice if the commit message hid/removed this. _Although as I am writing this, it maybe a bad idea to remove this from the commit message altogether as it is useful to see the issue number when listing the commit messages._
fields.summary: Remove/hide Jira issue number from commit message

fields.description: The checkout branch in Source Tree feature is a nice touch to the application, however i would love to see it added to the overview page of a pull request so that I can quickly checkout the source branch to do a more in depth review and testing of the application easier.
fields.summary: Ability to checkout the source branch of a pull requests from the PR overview page

fields.description: I would love the ability to search pull requests for comments people have made.  We have cases where we need to reference an open, merged, or declined pull requests that we commented on, but can't remember which one it was.  It would be nice to be able to search across all pull requests for a repository to find the pull requests that contain the search terms.
fields.summary: Ability to search for comments within Pull Requests

fields.description:
We are missing many useful stats in PRs (git diff --stat type info):

* Number of commits in pull request
* Number of files changed
* Overall number of lines added / removed
* Per-file number of lines added / removed

These help rapidly get the sense of scale of a PR.
fields.summary: Provide stats/summary of PR

fields.description: current stash will render a link for gitmodules that have an absolute path as url, but we're using relative paths instead. stash currently doesn't render those links
fields.summary: have stash recognize relative url's for git submodules

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to mark comments/changes as "done" , and consequently to optionally hide the 'done' comments in the pull request summary.

In alternative it would be sufficient to be able to hide specific pull request comments.

This is useful when making the suggested changes to the pull request, and having to track a large number of "done/not done" items can be annoying.
fields.summary: Mark Pull Request Comments as 'Done'

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce this problem:
- Create a new feature branch, make some commits
- Create a pull request in Stash
- Approve the pull request and merge it (also delete the branch)
- Test fails, ticket goes back to development
- Development creates the branch by clicking on "Create branch" in JIRA
- Some commits on the "new" branch (with same name)
- Create a new pull request
- Decline the pull request (e.g. because of bad code)
- Now there is no open pull request for the branch, only one merged and one declined
- Branch is now shown as _Merged_ in the branch list in stash, but actually it was _Declined_ in the last pull request. Looks like the first pull request is used to show the pull request state in the branch list. But in our opinion it should use the newest pull request.
fields.summary: "Pull requests" column in branch list shows wrong state

fields.description: If you commit something like: "VectorCAST-3.1 project 'c_version' ported to VectorCAST-6.1i", Stash will incorrectly pick up "CAST-3" and "CAST-6" as JIRA issues.
fields.summary: False-positive issue key recognition in whole word

fields.description:
Currently, when you have a repository with some permissions set up and create a new fork from it, the new repository will not have the same permissions. I'm not sure if this is the intended behavior or just not implemented, but it would be nice to be able to copy permissions from the parent repository, ideally automatically.

The use case here is that there are main repositories to which developers have access and they create forks for their own development. It makes sense for all developers with access to the main repositories to also have access to the developer repositories. It's frustrating that when you create a pull request, the reviewer does not have access to the source repository and can't do manual testing/merge.

If you see a use case where it's not a good idea to automatically copy the permissions, perhaps it could be an option on the permissions page.
fields.summary: Copy permissions when forking a repository

fields.description:
Currently you are not able to create a pull request when the source and target branch are on the same revision.  

We often create a new branch and a respective pull request _before_ we actually start with the development. So there is no difference in between the two branches at the beginning.

Could this behavior be changed?

I've searched the existing issues and found no similar ticket. If I am wrong -> sorry for that
fields.summary: Allow to create an empty pull request

fields.description:
- Open the Files or Commits page at a branch with an open PR.
- Merge that pull request with delete option checked
- Click the Commits nav item
URL includes reference to deleted branch : https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JAG/repos/jira-agile/commits?until=bugfix%2FGHS-10068
404 page not found

[movie]
fields.summary: 404 when navigating to Commits (nav item) after merging a pull request with the delete branch option checked

fields.description: You should be able to press `f` on the source view page and bring up the file finder to pick another file.
fields.summary: Make file finder accessible on Source view

fields.description:
Across all projects would be ideal, per project would be ok.

This is really useful to find old code.
fields.summary: Ability to see my closed/declined PRs

fields.description:
We were using the previous version of SQL server 2014 with both Jira and Stash.  The evaluation expired so we updated to CTP2.  Jira didn't have any issues with being attached to the new instance.  Stash on the other hand has the following error.

Caused by: org.hibernate.HibernateException: Wrong column type in stash.dbo.app_property for column prop_key. Found: nvarchar, expected: varchar(255)
	at org.hibernate.mapping.Table.validateColumns(Table.java:373) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration.validateSchema(Configuration.java:1284) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaValidator.validate(SchemaValidator.java:155) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.hibernate.internal.SessionFactoryImpl.<init>(SessionFactoryImpl.java:508) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration.buildSessionFactory(Configuration.java:1769) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration.buildSessionFactory(Configuration.java:1840) ~[hibernate-core-4.2.3.Final.jar:4.2.3.Final]
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate4.LocalSessionFactoryBuilder.buildSessionFactory(LocalSessionFactoryBuilder.java:247) ~[spring-orm-3.2.3.RELEASE.jar:3.2.3.RELEASE]
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate4.LocalSessionFactoryBean.buildSessionFactory(LocalSessionFactoryBean.java:373) ~[spring-orm-3.2.3.RELEASE.jar:3.2.3.RELEASE]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hibernate.ExtendedLocalSessionFactoryBean.buildSessionFactory(ExtendedLocalSessionFactoryBean.java:90) ~[stash-dao-impl-2.7.2.jar:na]

	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1479) ~[spring-beans-3.2.3.RELEASE.jar:3.2.3.RELEASE]

fields.summary: Add support for SQL Server 2014

fields.description:
*Current Behavior and Suggestion*:
Developers can only have one open PR for each branch. Sometimes, they might want to separate the new commits from the opened PR to have it on a new PR in the *same branch*
fields.summary: Allow more than 1 PR for each branch

fields.description:
{code}
2014-01-21 13:19:50,369 ERROR [rescope-details:thread-2]  c.a.s.i.c.StateTransferringExecutor Error while processing asynchronous task
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.pull.rescope.DefaultRescopeProcessor.process(DefaultRescopeProcessor.java:84) ~[stash-service-impl-2.10.1.jar:na]

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a lightweight ticket system in stash like bitbucket already has.
I know that jira is being integrated and linked with stash, but it was frustrating for me and my team to use the ticket system of jira efficiently. It is way too big! 
If anybody wants to use jira instead of the lightweight ticket system it should be possible to create a project preference in order to disable it (as an example).
Please keep in mind that I am not the only one sharing this opinion, there are also some older issues telling the same story.
fields.summary: Lightweight Ticket System

fields.description:
We have established a multi-level Active Directory group hierarchy within our organization that describes teams and sub-teams. One use for this hierarchy is that a group that is higher in the hierarchy can be used as a mailing list alias for all of the groups underneath it.

It would be useful if we could leverage this Active Directory hierarchy for Stash permissions, as well.  As it stands, we cannot make use of "super groups" to designate permissions to branches, projects, and repositories; we can only use groups that directly contain a person.  This results in much duplicated information and administrative overhead.

Instead of the current permissions-checking algorithm, potentially Stash could traverse the LDAP "Member Of" group relationships until it finds a group that matches the permission in question.

I'm not sure whether the functionality described by the submitter of STASH-3845 is the same as what I'm looking for.
fields.summary: Consider LDAP group hierarchy when determining permissions for users in subgroups
Remove required plugins that are "disabled" from {{plugin_state}} upon application start

fields.description:
As a developer I want to see source code of my Handlebars template highlighted. Typically, the files have .hbs or .handlebars extension.

More about Handlebars: http://handlebarsjs.com/
fields.summary: Handlebars syntax highlighting

fields.description:
Symptom: for a specific repository JIRA issues in commit messages are no longer indexed.

In Stash 2.10 when the indexing of commits takes longer than 10 minutes (which is very unusual) a timeout occurs and the repository that is being indexed is now "locked" for indexing until Stash is restarted. Plugins like [Badgr|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/nl.stefankohler.stash.badgr] can exacerbate the time taken to index a single repository, and should be disabled until Stash can be upgraded to a version without this bug.

To tell if this has happened to your index, look for the following in your {{$STASH_HOME/log/atlassian-stash.log}} file.

{noformat}
2013-12-08 22:28:00,202 INFO  [Indexer:thread-2] user 166x2877x0 jbz125 10.33.68.50 SSH - git-receive-pack '/project1/repo1.git' c.a.s.i.i.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl [PROJECT/repo[227]] Indexing SCM process has timed out, wrapping up the process
{noformat}

And this is not immediately followed by:

{noformat}
2013-12-17 21:04:31,770 DEBUG [Indexer:thread-2] user 166x2877x0 jbz125 10.33.68.50 SSH - git-receive-pack '/project1/repo1.git' c.a.s.i.i.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl [~PROJECT/repo[227]] Indexed 1234 changesets
{noformat}

Running a jstack command on the Stash Java process, or generating a Support Zip and looking at the {{thread-dump}} folder will contain a thread that is locked up:

{noformat}
[441] Indexer:thread-1: WAITING (waiting on java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject@291220f2)
   sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
   java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)
   java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043)
   java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.put(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:349)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.BlockingChangesetQueueCallback.onEnd(BlockingChangesetQueueCallback.java:58)
   com.atlassian.stash.content.AbstractChangesetCallback.onEnd(AbstractChangesetCallback.java:40)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.scm.git.command.revlist.CallbackRevListOutputHandler.onComplete(CallbackRevListOutputHandler.java:43)
   com.atlassian.stash.scm.SummarizingProcessHandler$AbstractStreamHandler.onComplete(SummarizingProcessHandler.java:141)
   com.atlassian.stash.scm.SummarizingProcessHandler.fireComplete(SummarizingProcessHandler.java:112)
   com.atlassian.stash.scm.SummarizingProcessHandler.complete(SummarizingProcessHandler.java:62)
   com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.wrapUpProcess(ExternalProcessImpl.java:659)
   com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.finish(ExternalProcessImpl.java:189)
   com.atlassian.stash.scm.BaseCommand$CommandFuture.cancel(BaseCommand.java:215)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl$IndexOperation.wrapUpCommand(ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.java:489)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl$IndexOperation.indexChangesets(ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.java:447)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl$IndexOperation.index(ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.java:366)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl$IndexOperation.perform(ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.java:273)
   com.atlassian.stash.internal.idx.ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.indexRepository(ChangesetIndexingServiceImpl.java:146)
{noformat}

To fix the indexing unfortunately the Stash instance will need to be restarted.
fields.summary: JIRA keys not being indexed for individual repositories

fields.description:
* Visit https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence-jira-metadata/pull-requests/57/overview
* Click CONFDEV-22116 on the right.
* See electric charlie :(
fields.summary: Clicking issue key from PR is broken on SAC

fields.description:
Running on Firefox 26 on Windows 7.

The username popup when you mouse-over a user picture often starts
behaving strangely. It will work right some places on the page and
some places not. See attached images for examples.

First image shows normal.
Second shows name appears inside of another user picture.
Third shows no username displays at all.
fields.summary: username popup on mouse-over of a user picture sometimes behaves strangely

fields.description: The file finder works on the view file page on bitbucket, but not on stash.
fields.summary: File finder doesn't work on view file page

fields.description:
Viewing http://.../repos/fmos/branches using Google Chrome Version 32.0.1700.76 m on Windows 7 causes Chrome to display its "Aw, Snap!" error page. 

The same Chrome bug (being tracked at https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=333594) is visible in the following places:

- Branches page
- Pull Requests list page
- viewing Blame of a file
- viewing History of a file
- possibly any other page that displays time information.

h4. Chrome fix schedule:

Chromium developers have noted that this should be merged today (Monday Jan 28, 2014), so presumably will be in the next Chrome update.

h4. Workarounds:

If this is affecting you, you can try another browser (e.g. Firefox), or install the attached plugin. The plugin provides simpler time-formatting code in Chrome 32 that doesn't hit the Chrome bug. Please be sure to uninstall this plugin once the bug is fixed in Chrome to return to view the nicer time formatting again.

h3. Chrome 33 has been released. We strongly recommend you upgrade Chrome which will resolve this issue. Stash 2.11 also ships with a new version of Moment.js which prevents the crash in Chrome 32.
fields.summary: Chrome 32 crashes when viewing branches, pull requests, or other pages that display time

fields.description:
The goal is to evaluate an existing branching model (for example, during a migration to Git/Stash of an existing repository.) The [conditions for automatic merging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Automatic+branch+merging#Automaticbranchmerging-Conditionsforautomaticmerging] are strict and this feature can confirm that the chosen branching model has enabled automatic merging.

In case of error, explicit details could be helpful of course.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to check that my branching model fulfill the conditions for automatic merging

fields.description:
When transitioning a JIRA issue from a Stash that contains a "Number" custom field, the following error comes up:

"Operation value must be a number"

The transition does not happen successfully. 

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/346285/gPYYiShn2s7CsnN/2.10.1.png!

*Workaround:* Transition the issue directly from JIRA.

If the field is not supported, the correct behaviour would be to send the user to edit that field in JIRA. See image below (correctly exhibited in versions before release 2.10):

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/346285/ELEUM9F60ORfMN3/2.8.1.png!
fields.summary: Error transitioning JIRA issues containing a Number custom field

fields.description:
[Allowing public access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Allowing+public+access+to+code] for Stash is possible, however in various cases code being semi-public would only be desired for people on an internal network, whereas authentication should still be required for external users.

Please provide a way to allow an IP range/subnet to access code but do require authentication from other sources.
fields.summary: IP-range based public access
